purpleculture_pinyin:
chū
variant of 出 (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
вариант 出 (классификатор пьес или глав классических романов)
heisig_chinese_memo: In some TV shows the actor/actress's teeth are so perfect you just stare at them every sentence they speak.
Ru_trainchinese: chū: (сч.слово) (счетное слово для пьесы, глав классических романов или актов в драме)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In some TV shows the actor/actress's teeth are so perfect you just stare at them every sentence they speak.
humanum_full_description_en: From the " teeth ", " sentence " sound, originally referred to a paragraph in the legend, with the drama of the " fold close." "Zihuibu‧ Tebu": "To come out, one episode of the legend is one to come out." After " out " refers to an independent passage or repertoire in a traditional opera. It can also be written as " out ". "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 58: "It's only going to be two plays, it's like killing the king of thieves and capturing the rebellion!"
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " tooth " and " sentence ", it originally refers to a paragraph in the legend.
humanum_full_description: 從「齒」，「句」聲，原指傳奇中的一個段落，同雜劇中的「折」相近。《字彙補‧齒部》：「齣，傳奇之的一迴為一齣。」「齣」後泛指戲曲中一個獨立段落或劇目，也可寫作「出」。《紅樓夢》第58回：「也不過是會兩齣戲，倒像殺了賊王，擒過反叛來的！」
humanum_short_description: 從「齒」，「句」聲，原指傳奇中的一個段落。

chu1
HSK 2: 出
HSK 5: 初
Freq: 8440
Chinese: In some TV shows the actor/actress's teeth are so perfect you just stare at them every sentence they speak.
Meaning: shows
Hanzi: 出
Story: In some TV shows the actor/actress's teeth are so perfect you just stare at them every sentence they speak.
Kind: simplified
從「 齒 」，「 句 」聲，原指傳奇中的一個段落，同雜劇中的「 折 」相近。《字彙補‧齒部》：「齣，傳奇之的一迴為一齣。」「 齣 」後泛指戲曲中一個獨立段落或劇目，也可寫作「 出 」。《紅樓夢》第58回：「也不過是會兩齣戲，倒像殺了賊王，擒過反叛來的！」
From the " teeth", " sentence" sound, originally referred to a paragraph in the legend, with the drama of the " fold close." "Zihuibu‧ Tebu": "To come out, one episode of the legend is one to come out." After " out" refers to an independent passage or repertoire in a traditional opera. It can also be written as " out". "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 58: "It's only going to be two plays, it's like killing the king of thieves and capturing the rebellion!"

齣字的基本解释

齣
chū
见“出”??。

齣字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chū］
原指传奇中的一个段落。同杂剧中的“折”相近。今指戏曲中的一个独立的段落或剧目。

齣字的康熙字典解释

【補遺】【亥集】【齒字部】　齣； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1533第28
【字彙補】傳奇中一迴爲一齣，俗讀作尺。或云本是齝字，譌作齣也，蓋齝，乃食之已久，復出嚼之。今傳奇進而復出，故有取于齝云。

齣字的源字形

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chū］
Originally refers to a paragraph in the legend. It is similar to the "zhe" in Zaju. Today refers to an independent passage or repertoire in Chinese opera.
Out
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Addendum] [Haiji] [Tooth Character Department] 　出; Kangxi strokes: 20; Page number: page 1533 28
【Word Supplement】In the legend, one time is one, and it is commonly pronounced as a ruler. Or Yunben is the word "齝", and the word "Zhao" made it, covered with 齝, which has been eaten for a long time, and come back to chew it. Today the legend has come back, so it was taken from Kuangyun.
